unnormalised: New Delhi – The ongoing expansion of Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure across India continues to gain momentum, driven by increased demand for high-speed internet and government initiatives like BharatNet. Telecom giants, including Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel, are aggressively rolling out fiber optic cables to connect homes directly.

unnormalised: Recent reports indicate a significant surge in FTTH subscriptions, particularly in Tier-II and Tier-III cities such as Lucknow and Patna. This growth is attributed to the availability of affordable data plans and the increasing adoption of online services, including e-learning and telemedicine.

unnormalised: The expansion also creates employment opportunities in the telecom sector. Airtel recently announced investments of Rs. 5,000 Crore in laying over 10,000 km of fiber optic cable in the next fiscal year. This will enable them to reach an additional 2 million homes, offering speeds up to 1 Gbps. Property developers are also increasingly incorporating FTTH infrastructure into new housing projects, providing residents with pre-installed connectivity options. A typical modern apartment spanning 1,200 sq ft now often comes FTTH ready. The increased coverage is expected to further bridge the digital divide across the country.
